problems.title: Array Pointer Manipulation
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.
problems.explanation:
Pointer arithmetic:
1. arr[] = {10, 20, 30, 40}
2. ptr = arr (points to arr[0]=10)
3. *ptr = 10, print '10 '
4. ptr += 2 (now points to arr[2]=30)
5. *ptr = 30, print '30 '
6. *(ptr-1) = arr[1] = 20, print '20'

Output: 10 30 20

problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.

problems.title: 2D Array Access
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.
problems.explanation:
2D array access:
matrix[0][0]=1, matrix[0][1]=2, matrix[0][2]=3
matrix[1][0]=4, matrix[1][1]=5, matrix[1][2]=6

i=0: matrix[0][0+1] = matrix[0][1] = 2, print '2 '
i=1: matrix[1][1+1] = matrix[1][2] = 6, print '6 '

Output: 2 6

problems.title: Bitwise Operations
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.

problems.title: Function with Reference
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.
problems.explanation:
Pass by reference:
1. num = 5
2. modify(num): x refers to num, x = 5*2 = 10, num becomes 10
3. Print num = 10, output '10 '
4. modify(num): x refers to num, x = 10*2 = 20, num becomes 20
5. Print num = 20, output '20'

Output: 10 20

problems.title: Continue Statement
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.
problems.explanation:
Loop with continue:
i=1: 1%3=1 (not 0), print '1 '
i=2: 2%3=2 (not 0), print '2 '
i=3: 3%3=0 (true), continue (skip print)
i=4: 4%3=1 (not 0), print '4 '
i=5: 5%3=2 (not 0), print '5 '
i=6: 6%3=0 (true), continue (skip print)

Output: 1 2 4 5

problems.title: Switch Case
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.
problems.explanation:
Switch without break:
1. x = 2
2. Match case 2: print 'B'
3. No break, fall through to case 3
4. Print 'C'
5. Break statement stops execution

Output: BC

problems.title: Nested Conditionals
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.
problems.explanation:
Nested if-else:
1. a=10, b=5, c=15
2. Check a > b: 10 > 5 = true, enter outer if
3. Check c > a: 15 > 10 = true, enter inner if
4. Print 'X'

Output: X

problems.title: String Character Access
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.
problems.explanation:
String iteration with separator:
i=0: print str[0]='C', i<3 true, print '-'
i=1: print str[1]='O', i<3 true, print '-'
i=2: print str[2]='D', i<3 true, print '-'
i=3: print str[3]='E', i<3 false, no '-'

Output: C-O-D-E

problems.title: Do-While Loop
problems.description: Trace the code and predict the exact output.
problems.explanation:
Do-while executes at least once:
Iteration 1: print '0 ', x = 0+2 = 2, check 2<5 (true)
Iteration 2: print '2 ', x = 2+2 = 4, check 4<5 (true)
Iteration 3: print '4 ', x = 4+2 = 6, check 6<5 (false), stop

Output: 0 2 4
